Posts.Content: I went to gp last week coz my arm and particularly around elbow was sore and painful. Prescribed anti biotics for query c ellulitus now been back for review and put on another week of antibiotics and a blood test and gp wants gout rulled out.has anyone else experienced this. The affected arm is the arm I had 20 lymph nodes out and lumpectomy side.
Posts.Title: gout

Posts.Content: Thank you for that. I feel reassured it's c ellulitus and not gout . they took blood to rule out gout today. When something like this happens on your affected arm you worry it's start of lymphodema.  I have my first T weds after 3 fec. I'm hoping it doesn't affect me too much as I already have dodgey hip joint and arthritis is lower disc enough to cause pain when walking.  I remain upbeat and determined to stay positive. This Trojan horse C will not infect my motherboard! I believe thats what they call nerve centres of a pc!
Posts.Title: gout

Posts.Content: When should I start painting them black? I'm due second chemo Wednesday
Posts.Title: Nails!!!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Gaynor I had heard painting nails black was advisable just needed to know when. So thanks for info, it really helps to talk to others. Take care Maryon
Posts.Title: Nails!!!!!

Posts.Content: I find my pulse raises at the simplest of exertion which prior to chemo I enjoyed shopping and browsing now I cant do any of this. Shopping I dread doing, I get breathless and sweaty,find it traumatic at times.I wasn't in best shape before but was doing gym 3 times a week to build stamina, now a simple walk is too much. I am going to speak to consultant next visit and get checked out.
Posts.Title: Frustrated lack of energy

Posts.Content: Hi there I complained about dryness of mouth at chemo the other day wish I had before. The nurse gave me biotene to try and what a difference it made!  It's a saliva replacement gel. It's brilliant and leaves your tongue feeling so much better. Ask for some on prescription when you go next.  As an added info, I was told by a friend to use a soft children's brush and euthymol toothpaste to minimise mouth ulcers. I have barely had any mouth ulcers since 3rd chemo. I still swill with difflam mouth wash that hospital gave me as well.  Hope this helps people.
Posts.Title: help with mouth dryness

Posts.Content: Waiting for results is excruciating I agree. I too had cancer In 1 node. They took 20 nodes from me, the plan was to take 3 but ended up taking 20! When they discussed results they said I would need chemo for 6 cycles then radiotherapy afterwards. Fingers crossed for you
Posts.Title: Waiting for results a nightmare

Posts.Content: Hi O would agree with all said, I have a Hickman line in as they couldn't get a picc line in, my veins are crap. But its so much better having a line in, it saves you running risk of veins in hand being damaged and makes it so less stressful having chemo. Embrace it and don't fret
Posts.Title: JANUARY CHEMO CLUB
